output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, students will be equipped with a foundational understanding of basic nursing procedures, enabling them to provide safe and effective patient care under supervision.
output.introduction: Welcome to Basic Nursing Procedures! This course is designed for intermediate-level learners and provides a comprehensive overview of essential nursing skills. Each module is designed to take approximately 10 minutes to read.

chapters.description: Learn how to accurately measure body temperature using oral, axillary, tympanic, and rectal methods. Understand normal ranges and factors influencing temperature.
Master the technique of assessing pulse rate, rhythm, and strength. Identify different pulse sites and understand the significance of abnormal findings.
Learn to observe and count respiratory rate, depth, and pattern. Recognize signs of respiratory distress and understand common respiratory abnormalities.
Understand the principles of blood pressure measurement using a sphygmomanometer. Learn proper technique and identify factors affecting blood pressure readings.
Understand the importance of hand hygiene in preventing infection. Learn the proper techniques for handwashing and using alcohol-based hand rubs.
Learn how to select and use appropriate PPE, including gloves, masks, gowns, and eye protection, to protect yourself and patients from infection.
Understand the risks associated with sharps injuries and learn safe practices for handling and disposing of needles and other sharp instruments.
Learn how to maintain a clean and safe patient environment, including proper disposal of waste and disinfection of surfaces.
Learn common patient positions, such as supine, prone, lateral, and Fowler's, and their indications. Understand how to safely assist patients with positioning.
Learn proper body mechanics and techniques for safely moving and lifting patients to prevent injury to yourself and the patient.
Learn how to assist patients with walking, using assistive devices such as walkers and canes, and ensuring patient safety.
Understand the importance of range of motion exercises and learn how to assist patients with active and passive range of motion exercises.
Learn how to assist patients with oral hygiene, including brushing teeth, flossing, and using mouthwash. Understand the importance of oral hygiene for patient health.
Learn how to assist patients with bathing, providing skin care, and preventing skin breakdown. Understand the importance of hygiene for patient comfort and well-being.
Learn how to assist patients with dressing and grooming, respecting their preferences and promoting their independence.
Learn how to assist patients with feeding, ensuring proper positioning, and monitoring for swallowing difficulties. Understand dietary considerations for different patient populations.

modules.moduleTitle: Assisting with Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
